alert.note: Alert for Hunterdon; Morris; Somerset; Sussex; Warren (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 19 at 1:36PM EST until February 19 at 2:30PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Morris County in northern New Jersey... Hunterdon County in northwestern New Jersey... Sussex County in northwestern New Jersey... Warren County in northwestern New Jersey... Northern Somerset County in northern New Jersey... Southeastern Lehigh County in eastern Pennsylvania... Northwestern Bucks County in southeastern Pennsylvania... Southeastern Monroe County in northeastern Pennsylvania... Northampton County in eastern Pennsylvania... * Until 230 PM EST. * At 136 PM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from near Alpine Mountain to near Emmaus, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts greater than 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes the following highways... Northeast Extension between mile markers 48 and 50. Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 59 and 76. Interstate 78 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 39. Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 309 and 314. Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 47. Interstate 287 in New Jersey between mile markers 14 and 54. Locations impacted include... Allentown, Easton, Morristown, Somerville, Newton, Montague, Bethlehem, Bridgewater, Dover, Madison, Hopatcong, Forks, Florham Park, Emmaus, East Hanover, Lincoln Park, Bound Brook, Manville, Kinnelon and East Stroudsburg. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce your speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions.
